column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=The sample preparation was performed in a specialized
#Text=laboratory, equipped with an argon-filled glove box system (MBraun, p(H2O/O2 ) < 0.1 ppm) [31].
#Text=Polycrystalline samples of R4Be33Pt16 (R = Y, La–Nd, Sm–Lu) were
#Text=synthesized by arc melting of R (pieces, Ames Laboratory, >99.9%), Be (sheet, Heraeus, >99.9%), and Pt (foil,
#Text=Chempur, >99.9%) in the 10:60:30 ratio.
#Text=In order to ensure
#Text=homogeneity, all samples were arc melted several times, with
#Text=final mass losses of at most 2%.
#Text=Small inclusions of secondary
#Text=phases were identified by several experimental methods (see
#Text=below), while temperature treatment, as well as changing the
#Text=initial composition, did not result in completely single-phase
#Text=samples.
#Text=Since the amount of Be is hard to quantify analytically (see below), and given that the evaporation losses of Be
#Text=are unavoidable, the only way to keep control of the sample
#Text=composition is to follow a careful weighing protocol.
#Text=None of
#Text=the samples exhibited any marked air or moisture sensitivity
